website_summaries.verdict: The fleece lining and GORE-TEX insert team up for a flexible, warm, waterproof fit. On the off chance they get too warm, you can just wear the liner.
pros: Breathable, removable, stretch-fleece lining dries quickly and wicks moisture from skin
Articulated fit keeps gloved hands nimble and warm
cons: Gloves are a little bulky, but they keep you warm

customer_reviews.title: causing your feet and hands to go numb VERY EASILY. it SUCKS
customer_reviews.text: I have Reynauds disease. Not deadly, but your blood vessels/capillaries in your feet and fingers shrink at the first sign of cold, causing your feet and hands to go numb VERY EASILY. it SUCKS. It is NOT FUN being in the snow when this happens. These gloves were the FIRST for this NOT to happen! My hands were warm. I was so happy. They finally starting going a little numb after an hour or two but it was only one or two fingers.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: The inner lining gloves are great to wear separate for normal winter days
customer_reviews.text: The inner lining gloves are great to wear separate for normal winter days, and I love the touch sensitive material for using my phone and car touch screen. The gortex gloves are great with keeping my hands toasty warm. Work the liner gloves plus the gortex gloves the fit is slightly small but without the liner the gloves fit fine. With both gloves together the fit is just snug but I am able to move my hands well for winter snow storms and shovel, drive, etc...
customer_reviews.author: JScurini

customer_reviews.title: ... many times is sub zero temperatures and couldn't be happier with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: Used these many times is sub zero temperatures and couldn't be happier with my purchase. These gloves and liner gloves work great to keep my hands warm with hand warmers in though temperatures and can still easily complete fine motor tasks. Material has held up and do not see it being an issue any time soon. Just remember to take care of the gloves and they will take care of you.
customer_reviews.author: aliedobo

customer_reviews.title: Everything I needed and more
customer_reviews.text: According to the Burton website I was supposed to be a size Small but I ordered extra small and they fit perfectly. I have baby hands and these were great. The liner gloves aren't touchscreen which I believe they claim to be, but they have an excellent grip. Held up well and were very warm skiing in Montana. Deducting a star only for the liner not being touchscreen as claimed (which I really wasn't bothered by anyway) and the Burton size chart being a little off based on my measurements saying I was a small.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Hot Hands will fit...
customer_reviews.text: Fits as expected. The Gore-Tex layer makes these a little thicker than the burton Profile gloves. Nice included liner. Hot hands hand warmers fit perfectly into the zipper vent area on the back of the hand. Love the Velcro on these gloves so much easier to use than Burtons convoluted cord-pulley tightening system they have on a lot of their gloves including a version of this same glove. I had burton profile gloves that ripped after about eight uses snowboarding. I am hopeful these do better; I have used them once so far.
customer_reviews.author: Johnazon

customer_reviews.title: Too Big
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, I bought the size that was recommended for my wife's hand measurement. They are far too big. I'm not sure if the measurement was off or the gloves sizing is off. It's a shame because they appear to be quality gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Trofe

customer_reviews.title: Could have been good, but...
customer_reviews.text: I loved these gloves. They're beautiful, feel warm, have an inner lining that can be removed and worn separately. The only problem is, the first time I wore them while skiing I noticed a small stitching error in the side, which allowed cold air to get inside. Pretty disappointed that these we for sale without a discount with such an error. Snow gear should only be sold when its made 100% or it won't keep you warm.
customer_reviews.author: Elle Dodd

customer_reviews.title: great gloves
customer_reviews.text: my wife has extremely poor circulation so i was looking for a quality pair of gloves for her to use when snowboarding. the quality of the gloves is great and they kept her hands warm on the mountain all day in 10 degree temp without the inner liners. will see how they hold up over time but so far they are well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: I read that the fingers were small, but as ...
customer_reviews.text: I read that the fingers were small, but as I have small hands I wasn’t worried. I thought I would finally have gloves where the fingers weren’t too long! However, to my surprise the fingers are extremely oddly short! If your nails don’t pass your finger tips at all, they may fit but you still need to have short fingers. Maybe some defective pairs made it through quality control.....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves and great customer service!
customer_reviews.text: Great gloves, very warm. Come with glove liner pair as well! Great customer service from Blauer Board Shop! They seemed to run large, so I had to exchange my Ladies Medium for a small, but an easy process thanks to Blauer Board Shop.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best gloves I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Best gloves I have ever owned! Have of the time I only wore the liners, they were thin but still kept my hands so warm. I love the cord, it was nice to be able to take my gloves off and not worry about losing them because they were still attached at my wrist.
customer_reviews.author: George Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: she loves them and says they are super warm. We tested that during a 15 degree ...
customer_reviews.text: Got these as a gift for my significant other... she loves them and says they are super warm. We tested that during a 15 degree day on the mountain... no complaints from her. Another great product Burton.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: these gloves were awesome in the snow
customer_reviews.text: For warmth, these gloves were awesome in the snow! They are a little cumbersome to put on, with the added liner, but I'm glad to have the liner as an extra layer of warmth. My only complaint is that I have long fingers, and I felt like the gloves didn't fit that part of my hand well. I'd still definitely recommend these to anyone who has trouble with poor circulation or numb hands in the snow!
customer_reviews.author: L. Kitahara

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my daughter who is a state trooper. The cold winter nights can really get brutal. She really likes them. Said they keep her hand warm and toasty.
customer_reviews.author: Cierra

customer_reviews.title: Not warm, very dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: My wife has complained about cold hands, and I blamed her for purchasing cheap gloves. For Christmas I got here these Burton gloves, specifically because they were advertised to be warm (because of the liner, layering?). Her hands were very cold after only a few minutes of cross country skiing, we had to return to warm up. Unfortunately we waited for the snow, and the return window closed. Now we have another pair of junk gloves, but $70 spent! BTW, her feet are fine in the boots - why can boots provide necessary insulation but these expensive gloves do not?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Always buy  Burton!
customer_reviews.text: I ski HARD. I went through a bunch of gloves, and only Burton keeps my hands warm and dry. I go through at least a pair a year and this style of gloves has never let me down.
customer_reviews.author: sonnin dahl

customer_reviews.title: Cost-effective winter gear
customer_reviews.text: My hands are kind of on the smaller end so I was worried it might not fit my fingers well, but it does a fairly good job. The gloves kept me warm through the coldest winter yet, and though I lost my liner gloves, they're still great on their own. And their touchscreen function is better than most gloves I've used!
customer_reviews.author: Chingoo

customer_reviews.title: Warm
customer_reviews.text: Love these gloves. Before I couldn’t find a glove that kept my hand warm-I would even stick hand warmers in my gloves-but these keep my hands nice and warm
customer_reviews.author: Kallista Hiraoka

customer_reviews.title: Stay Warm in Style
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are the best of the best. They look great, they kept my hands warm, almost too warm... good thing they come with liners that come out! Style, Comfort, Great Fit and perfect in every way!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Burton Women's Gore-tex Under Goves
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are awesome, went snow skiing for 4 days (snowed 24" first day) kept my hands warm and dry entire time. The inner glove is awesome when you want to take a picture but you don't want to freeze your hands doing it. Couldn't ask for a better glove.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy P

customer_reviews.title: Good but difficult to wear
customer_reviews.text: They're clumsy and hard to put on. Once I wrestled them on, they were very warm, and even had a pocket for a hand warmer, but I'm not sure it's worth the hassle
customer_reviews.author: Julia Martins

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value
customer_reviews.text: If you're unsure of your size, definitely use the Burton glove sizing chart. I would have gotten too small a glove if I didn't check first! The gloves are great quality and come with an inner glove that is surprisingly water resistant. Great deal.
customer_reviews.author: sloanrx

customer_reviews.title: Burtons quality???
customer_reviews.text: Got these 4 days ago... and on my first day in the mountains, the glove unsewed itself in the bottom part. Extremely disappointed... are these real Burtons?
customer_reviews.author: Leka’s World

customer_reviews.title: Great glove!
customer_reviews.text: Top notch glove. Have purchased these as gifts and for ourselves - these have always been well received.
customer_reviews.author: Rob930

customer_reviews.title: Gore-tex material is best! I got an XS it is a tad ...
customer_reviews.text: Kept my hands warm and dry in snow all day and during night skiing. You can put your hands in wet and they still dry inside! Gore-tex material is best! I got an XS it is a tad still small but my hands are tiny!
customer_reviews.author: Maars3

customer_reviews.title: These were purchased as a replacement for the identical gloves ...
customer_reviews.text: These were purchased as a replacement for the identical gloves I had for 8 years. These were much bulkier between the fingers making it uncomfortable and difficult to have control skiing.
customer_reviews.author: Lauran Kunze

customer_reviews.title: Good gloves
customer_reviews.text: Love these gloves! Super warm! Kind of bulky though and the liners are not touch screen sensitive
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Kept my daughters hands warm and dry snowboarding! Minus 1 star for lack of style.
customer_reviews.author: Lhr4lax

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Wore in a winter vaca in Alaska and stayed warm!
customer_reviews.author: belle

customer_reviews.title: Love these for the comfortable fabric on the thumb that ...
customer_reviews.text: Love these for the comfortable fabric on the thumb that you can wipe your nose on. It's a game changer in the snow when your nose is running.
customer_reviews.author: M. Martorella

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are so perfect! They are nice and warm and fit as expected. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Love all the features
customer_reviews.text: Love all the features, especially the velcros instead of drawstring. I also like the color, my old black gloves rubbed off on my jacket but these don't! These kept me warm in white out conditions, the liner is definitely a bonus!
customer_reviews.author: TraySwei

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Just like the ones at the store but cheaper! Great deal and very comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Alejandra Perez

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work on cell phones
customer_reviews.text: Why doesn't the inside gloves work on cell phones? That's why I bought them so I didn't have to take everything off.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Snug and Toasty
customer_reviews.text: I have small or at least normal sized hands. My Dakine gloves were XSMALL and fit perfect, I felt obliged to order these in a SMALL. I do feel I could have been just a bit happier in a MEDIUM, oh well, so they're a tad snug. They keep my hands dry and warm. Even without the liner glove layer the shell still keeps my hands toasty on warmer days!
customer_reviews.author: SBL

customer_reviews.title: Great glove, even for beginners. Warm and Dry under freezeing or warm temps.
customer_reviews.text: Wife has had 0 issues. Sher bought a cheap pair prior to her first snowboarding trip, which I did try and advise against. After she realized her mistake I recommended these as I've used them a number of times now. They kept her hands dry and warm. She is a beginner and did spend a good amount fo time with her hands in the snow. They never got wet and in the latest trip (65F+) they kept her hands dry. Size seems true to fit, don't try and go small, you typically want your hands to breathe, thus liners are often used and provided as with these.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Very warm and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Love these are great. They are very warm and the gloves lining are perfect as it allows you to dry them out at night.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia

customer_reviews.title: It does what it do
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my girlfriend, fits like a glove. Thanks for doing what you do so well.
customer_reviews.author: BooksBooksBooks

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: the gloves I bought work great. A little pricey. Good thing I had gift cards
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Burton Women's Gore-Tex Warm Technology Under Gloves
product_meta.description:
Systematic storm-proofing with 2-in-1 versatility for when you don''t know what the weather will bring.

The life of a glove is not easy. More than any other part of your riding kit, gloves have the most contact with the elements. With that in mind, the Burton team chooses the bestselling women’s Burton GORE-TEX Under Glove. DRYRIDE Durashell 2L fabric, and a GUARANTEED TO KEEP YOU DRY GORE-TEX membrane protect this Thermacore insulated glove from burly conditions. Screen Grab synthetic leather gives you stealth touchscreen control with any finger. A removable four-way stretch fleece liner dries quickly and gives you options for any weather. Wear just the liner when shoveling, just the shell in sloppy spring conditions, or combine the two for total midwinter warmth and comfort.

Key Features of the Burton Gore-Tex Under Gloves:


 *  Screen Grab Toughgrip Palm for Total Touchscreen Control
 *  Dryride Ultrashell 2-Layer Fabric
 *  Gore-Tex Waterproof/Breathable Glove Membrane
 *  Brushed Microfiber Lining
 *  Thermacore Insulation
 *  Removable, 4-Way Stretch Dryride Thermex Liner
 *  Sticky Icky Grip Palm
 *  Ergonomic Pre-Curved Fit
 *  Hidden Heater/Vent Pocket
feature_bullets: DRYRIDE two-layer fabric with Gore warm technology offers a dry and breathable level of performance
Screen Grab Toughgrip palm won't fray or wear out and features built-in touchscreen-compatible technology
Brushed microfiber fixed lining with Thermacore insulation keeps hands warm while limiting bulk; Comfortable ergonomic fit
Removable four-way stretch DRYRIDE Thermex liner provides amplified warmth and versatility; Sticky Icky grip palm offers a firm handle for securing any tool
Hidden heater/vent pocket can hold a disposable hand warmer or provide ventilation; Removable wrist leash

Durably Waterproof, Windproof, and Breathable GORE-TEX Membrane
